meanings.definition: Causing or expressing wailing or lamentation.
meanings.sent1: The wailsome sound of the wind made the children feel scared.
meanings.sent2: The funeral was a wailsome event, filled with tears and sorrow.
meanings.sent3: The wailsome howling of the dog made everyone in the neighborhood sympathize with its loneliness.
meanings.sent4: The wailsome melody of the song echoed through the empty hall, stirring up emotions.
meanings.sent5: The wailsome cries of the baby could be heard from across the street, tugging at the heartstrings of passersby.
